### LLVMGetStructElementTypes() {#ga807ba6d2f3f519cf9fca4b74453ef0bf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMGetStructElementTypes (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab81b4df33167d47174f9b86a75e3be88">LLVMTypeRef</a> StructTy, <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab81b4df33167d47174f9b86a75e3be88">LLVMTypeRef</a> &#42; Dest)</>}>
Get the elements within a structure.

The function is passed the address of a pre-allocated array of <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab81b4df33167d47174f9b86a75e3be88">LLVMTypeRef</a> at least <a href="#gaf32e6d6bcec38b786efbef689b0dddf7">LLVMCountStructElementTypes()</a> long. After invocation, this array will be populated with the structure&#39;s elements. The objects in the destination array will have a lifetime of the structure type itself, which is the lifetime of the context it is contained in.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l01515">1515</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l00826">826</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMStructTypeInContext() {#gaff2af74740a22f7d18701f0d8c3e5a6f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMTypeRef LLVMStructTypeInContext (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga9c43e01525516ff6b4feab5166c5b1da">LLVMContextRef</a> C, <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab81b4df33167d47174f9b86a75e3be88">LLVMTypeRef</a> &#42; ElementTypes, unsigned ElementCount, <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga209de0bceb13179a973c6a45211617bd">LLVMBool</a> Packed)</>}>
Create a new structure type in a context.

A structure is specified by a list of inner elements/types and whether these can be packed together.
